definition: to acknowledge sb as senior or superior (often in negative)/to accept (a version of events)/to buy it

sentences.english: When Baidu unveiled its long-term strategy, it wasn't well-received.
sentences.chinese: 百度公开其长期战略时，很多人并不买帐。

sentences.english: The Colossus was a unit that I wasn't sold on before playing it.
sentences.chinese: 巨像是个让我先前不太买帐的单位。

sentences.english: The trouble is that with packaged software like Microsoft's, customers won't fall for it.
sentences.chinese: 像微软这样升级软件带来的问题是，用户不买帐。

sentences.english: The American Medical Association isn't buying it.
sentences.chinese: 美国医学协会可不买帐。

sentences.english: The masses won't go for bureaucracy.
sentences.chinese: 对于官僚主义，群众是不买帐的。
这种‘买帐’我们已经有了。

definition: variant of 買帳|买帐[mai3 zhang4]
to feel grateful to sb/to appreciate the kindness
to show deference or praise publicly
to own up to a fault/to admit the truth/to acknowledge a debt
to show deference to sb by obliging them (or by obliging sb associated with them)
to put on airs/to assume great airs
to get the desired outcome/to win favor by fawning on sb/to curry favor with/a fruitful outcome to reward one's labor
to give up/to abandon (a goal etc)/to let sth go/forget it/let the matter drop
to be disgusted with/to dislike/bad reaction/antipathy
to snort disdainfully/to scoff at/to turn up one's nose
to be willing to do sth/to be ready to do sth/to be happy to do sth/content/satisfied
deliberately mystifying/to make sth unnecessarily complicated
